'''Xubuntu''' ({{pron-en|zuËËbuËntuË}}) is an official derivative of the [[Ubuntu (operating system)|Ubuntu]] [[operating system]], using the [[Xfce]] [[desktop environment]].<ref name="XubuntuAbout"> {{cite web|url = http://www.xubuntu.org/about|title = What is Xubuntu?|accessdate = 2009-02-10|last = [[Canonical Ltd.]]|authorlink = |year = 2008}}</ref><ref name="XubuntuGlossary"> {{cite web|url = http://www.xubuntu.org/glossary|title = Glossary|accessdate = 2009-02-10|last = [[Canonical Ltd.]]|authorlink = |year = 2008}}</ref>
Because the Xfce desktop environment uses fewer system resources than the default [[GNOME]], Xubuntu is often used on older computers, systems with limited resources, [[laptop]]s, [[netbook]]s and high-efficiency workstations.<ref name="XubuntuAbout" /><ref name="XubuntuDoc"> {{cite web|url = http://web.archive.org/web/20060617202944/http://help.ubuntu.com/xubuntu/desktopguide/C/introduction-chap.html|title = Xubuntu Documentation Chapter 1. Introduction|accessdate = 2009-02-10|last = [[Canonical Ltd.]]|authorlink = |year = 2006}}</ref>
Because the Xfce desktop environment uses fewer system resources than the default [[GNOME]], Xubuntu is often used on older computers, systems with limited resources, [[laptop]]s, [[netbook]]s and high-efficiency workstations.<ref name="XubuntuAbout" /><ref name="XubuntuDoc"> {{cite web|url = http://web.archive.org/web/20060617202944/http://help.ubuntu.com/xubuntu/desktopguide/C/introduction-chap.html|title = Xubuntu Documentation Chapter 1.
